oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Soldier resting on patrol near Vung Chua Mountain
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A young soldier, his face in profile, sitting on the ground in an area of tall dried vegetation. His uniform pants and shoes are very muddy. His left hand is resting on his left knee. He is smiling slightly. His M-16 rifle is loosely held in his right hand, the barrel pointing upwards and the butt resting on the ground beside his right shoe.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military uniforms; Rifles; Military personnel; Soldiers; Men
Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; United States. Army. Military Police Company, 194th; United States -- Armed Forces -- Ordnance and ordnance stores; Weapons; M-16 rifle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia, on April 18, 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970. His photographs show details of the daily life of soldiers in Vietnam.
